QuestionStem: How is the way the water falls in this model similar to the way rain falls on Earth? Select all that apply.

options.AnswerText: A. Gravity causes water to fall in both a fountain and rain.
B. Rain falls both up and down similar to the water in this fountain.
C. Water is cycled after falling in the fountain and when it rains.
D. Rain falls in a fixed location like the water in this fountain does.

CorrectFeedback: Rain falls as part of the cycling of water through the Earth system. Rain falls due to gravity, as does the water in this fountain.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Think about which processes occur as part of the fountain and as part of natural rainfall.
IncorrectFeedback: Think about which processes occur as part of the fountain and as part of natural rainfall.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Rain falls as part of the cycling of water through the Earth system. Rain falls due to gravity, as does the water in this fountain.
